meanings.definition: Arrange in a series of levels or grades.
meanings.sent1: She was echeloning the books on the shelf by size.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was echeloning the students based on their test scores.
meanings.sent3: The cat was echeloning its toys in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: The sun was echeloning its rays through the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was echeloning the flowers by color, creating a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: To place in a position of lesser importance or rank.
meanings.sent1: He felt like his boss was echeloning him by giving him mundane tasks.
meanings.sent2: The coach was echeloning the new players to the bench during the game.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was echeloning the acorns away from the serious squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The wind was echeloning the leaves to the ground, ignoring their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was echeloning the class clowns to the back of the room, hoping for less disruption.

meanings.definition: To form into a series of levels or grades.
meanings.sent1: The artist was echeloning the colors on the canvas to create a gradient effect.
meanings.sent2: The chef was echeloning the ingredients in the recipe for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The ants were echeloning the food crumbs back to their nest in an organized line.
meanings.sent4: The music was echeloning in volume, gradually building up to a crescendo.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was echeloning his steps up the mountain, taking breaks at each level.
